ca.ualberta.CMPUT301F13T02.chooseyouradventure

Class HelpPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.CMPUT301F13T02.chooseyouradventure.HelpPlayer

  • public class HelpPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for playing the audio help in the application. It is also responsible for managing the help items in the menu -- enabling and disabling them as necessary. This class uses the singleton design pattern and also the subscriber pattern.
    Author:
    Konrad Lindenbach

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static HelpPlayer getInstance()
      Get an instance of this class, instantiating it if necessary
      boolean isPlaying()
      Returns whether or not any help audio is playing
      void play(Context ctx, int resource)
      Play the audio corresponding to the passed resource, using the passed context.
      void trackHelpItem(MenuItem item)
      Adds the passed MenuItem as a subscriber of this object so it can be enable and disabled as necessary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static HelpPlayer getInstance()
        Get an instance of this class, instantiating it if necessary

      • play

        public void play(Context ctx,
        int resource)
        Play the audio corresponding to the passed resource, using the passed context. This method also makes sure to disable help buttons while audio is playing and re-enable them when audio stops.
        Parameters:
        ctx - The context to use to play this resource
        resource - The resource to play

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        Returns whether or not any help audio is playing
        Returns:
        Whether or not any help audio is playing

      • trackHelpItem

        public void trackHelpItem(MenuItem item)
        Adds the passed MenuItem as a subscriber of this object so it can be enable and disabled as necessary
        Parameters:
        item - The item to subscribe
